thread.title: Secret Service Investigating Report of Agent Abandoning Trump to Breastfeed Her Baby at N.C. Rally
thread.title_full: Secret Service Investigating Report of Agent Abandoning Trump to Breastfeed Her Baby at N.C. Rally

author: Mary Chastain
title: Secret Service Investigating Report of Agent Abandoning Trump to Breastfeed Her Baby at N.C. Rally
text:
Secret Service Investigating Report of Agent Abandoning Trump to Breastfeed Her Baby at N.C. Rally
It could be another black eye for the Secret Service.
39 Comments
The Secret Service has begun an investigation into a report of an agent abandoning her post protecting Republican candidate President Donald Trump to breastfeed her baby at his North Carolina Rally.
From Newsweek: ‚ÄúAll employees of the U.S. Secret Service are held to the highest standards. While there was no impact to the North Carolina event, the specifics of this incident are being examined. Given this is a personnel matter, we are not in a position to comment further.‚Äù
Susan Crabtree at RealClearInvestigations reported that a Secret Service (USSS) agent abandoned her post protecting Republican presidential candidate President Donald Trump to breastfeed her baby.
The agency
üö®üö®EXCLUSIVE and BREAKING: During a Donald Trump visit to North Carolina yesterday, a woman Secret Service special agent abandoned her post to breastfeed with no permission/warning to the event site agent, according to three sources in the Secret Service community.
Shortly‚Ä¶
[pic.twitter.com/lkfhhLcA0B]
‚Äî Susan Crabtree (@susancrabtree)
[August 15, 2024]
Crabtree wrote:
EXCLUSIVE and BREAKING: During a Donald Trump visit to North Carolina yesterday, a woman Secret Service special agent abandoned her post to breastfeed with no permission/warning to the event site agent, according to three sources in the Secret Service community.
Shortly before Trump‚Äôs motorcade arrival ‚Äî I‚Äôm told five minutes beforehand ‚Äî the site agent was getting ready for the arrival. (The site agent is the person in charge of the entire event‚Äôs security.)
The site agent went to do one final sweep of the walking route and found the agent breast-feeding her child in a room that is supposed to be set aside for important Secret Service official work, i.e. a potential emergency related to the president.
A working agent on duty cannot bring a child to a protective assignment. The woman was out of the Atlanta Field Office.
The woman agent was in the room with two other family members.
The agent and her family members bypassed the Uniformed Division checkpoint and were escorted by an unpinned event staff into the room to breastfeed, the sources said. Unpinned means they have not been cleared by the Secret Service to be there.
When contacted about the incident, Secret Service spokesman Anthony Guglielmi said the incident did not have an impact on the event. and it‚Äôs under review.
‚ÄúAll employees of the U.S. Secret Service are held to the highest standards,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWhile there was no impact to the North Carolina event, the specifics of this incident are being examined. Given this is a personnel matter, we are not in a position to comment further.‚Äù
So far, from what I can tell, Crabtree is the only one who has sources talking about the alleged incident.
